subject: Allow to customize volume type extra specs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6509, 'name': 'Roman Bogorodskiy', 'email': 'rbogorodskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'novel'}, {'_account_id': 9194, 'name': 'Emily Hugenbruch', 'email': 'ekhugenbruch@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'ekhugen'}, {'_account_id': 9624, 'name': 'Ramy Asselin', 'email': 'ramyasselin@yahoo.com', 'username': 'asselin'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10624, 'name': 'Brocade ADX CI', 'username': 'pattabi-ayyasami-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11075, 'name': 'Benny Kopilov', 'email': 'bkopilov@redhat.com', 'username': 'bkopilov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-09-17 10:54:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volume_types.py', 'etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Allow to customize volume type extra specs

Currently, when creating new volume types in tests, Tempest specifies
extra specs with fields "storage_protocol" and "vendor_name" that
could be specified in the config file in the "[volume]" section.

However, for the Cinder Coraid driver is not enough. It uses uses
type keys to associate with the Storage Repository by storing FQRN
of the repository in 'coraid_repository_key' key [1].

Therefore, the
test_create_get_delete_volume_with_volume_type_and_extra_specs test
fails as it creates a new volume type and uses it for the new volume
creation. And as this new volume type doesn't have
coraid_repository_key specified, the volume creation fails because
the Coraid driver does not know what repository to use.

Fix that by allowing to pass a custom set of volume type extra specs
by specifying a dictionary with key/value pairs.

1:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/coraid_creating_associating_volume_type.html

Change-Id: I667eb0b63f14010ae8410c17f48f67cd2ada0825
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to customize volume type extra specs

Currently, when creating new volume types in tests, Tempest specifies
extra specs with fields "storage_protocol" and "vendor_name" that
could be specified in the config file in the "[volume]" section.

However, for the Cinder Coraid driver is not enough. It uses uses
type keys to associate with the Storage Repository by storing FQRN
of the repository in 'coraid_repository_key' key [1].

Therefore, the
test_create_get_delete_volume_with_volume_type_and_extra_specs test
fails as it creates a new volume type and uses it for the new volume
creation. And as this new volume type doesn't have
coraid_repository_key specified, the volume creation fails because
the Coraid driver does not know what repository to use.

Fix that by allowing to pass a custom set of volume type extra specs
by specifying a dictionary with key/value pairs.

1:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/coraid_creating_associating_volume_type.html

Change-Id: I667eb0b63f14010ae8410c17f48f67cd2ada0825

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-27 14:36:42.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Remove duplicate HEAT_CFN_IMAGE_URL assignment

There are two places were the URL is assigned within stackrc.
It is impossible to override one of the assignments from localrc.
We want to be able to override it because, in our case, we can not
use https to retrieve the image.

With this commit we allow the URL to be configured and remove
redundant assignment.

Change-Id: I8e5ae77644cec2b87185d740505bc2bbce9c89ce

commit_message:
Remove duplicate HEAT_CFN_IMAGE_URL assignment

There are two places were the URL is assigned within stackrc.
It is impossible to override one of the assignments from localrc.
We want to be able to override it because, in our case, we can not
use https to retrieve the image.

With this commit we allow the URL to be configured and remove
redundant assignment.

Change-Id: I8e5ae77644cec2b87185d740505bc2bbce9c89ce

Newer versions of rabbitmq (3.3 and later) do not allow the 'guest'

commit_message:
create and use RABBIT_USERID instead of 'guest'.

Newer versions of rabbitmq (3.3 and later) do not allow the 'guest'
user to access on non-local interfaces.

Add the RABBIT_USERID configuration variable, which defaults to 'stackrabbit'.
Create and use that user instead of using the default 'guest'.

Closes-Bug: #1343354
Change-Id: I7f4e5aedc41f21d06b783a1faeb3e2552051032f

subject: Use "_member_" role instead of "Member"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6772, 'name': 'Stephen Gordon', 'email': 'sgordon@redhat.com', 'username': 'sgordon'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10234, 'name': 'Andrey Pavlov', 'email': 'andrey.mp@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrey-mp'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-26 02:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone', 'lib/swift', 'tools/create_userrc.sh', 'lib/tempest', 'exercises/neutron-adv-test.sh'], 'message': 'Use "_member_" role instead of "Member"

As Horizon now defaults to using the _member_ role, automatically
created by Keystone, there is no need to create a Member role.

This commit disables the creation of this additional role and modifies
the remaining dependencies on the Member role within devstack to use
_member_.

Additionally as all users who are created with an association to a
tenant are automatically given the _member_ role in that tenant, manual
inititiation of the role add command to explicitly add the role is
also no longer required.

Conflicts:
	lib/keystone
	lib/tempest

Change-Id: I29af9fb5dc52bc0af57509c1c0fed2345231f649
Closes-Bug: #1330132
'}]
commit_message:
Use "_member_" role instead of "Member"

As Horizon now defaults to using the _member_ role, automatically
created by Keystone, there is no need to create a Member role.

This commit disables the creation of this additional role and modifies
the remaining dependencies on the Member role within devstack to use
_member_.

Additionally as all users who are created with an association to a
tenant are automatically given the _member_ role in that tenant, manual
inititiation of the role add command to explicitly add the role is
also no longer required.

Conflicts:
	lib/keystone
	lib/tempest

Change-Id: I29af9fb5dc52bc0af57509c1c0fed2345231f649
Closes-Bug: #1330132

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-05 00:55:54.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Reorder network creation and Neutron agent startup

Due to a dependency in lib/neutron it is necessary to run the network
creation prior to agent startup.
This is safe as when the agents start, they will pick up their messages
from the queue

Closes-Bug: #1326484
Change-Id: Ic940ff49ded0a9ce30888c087be7c7de7d7e6b36
'}]
commit_message:
Reorder network creation and Neutron agent startup

Due to a dependency in lib/neutron it is necessary to run the network
creation prior to agent startup.
This is safe as when the agents start, they will pick up their messages
from the queue

Closes-Bug: #1326484

commit_message:
Add mgmt API for datastores

Implemented mgmt API calls for create/update datastores/versions.
To access this API call "admin" role is required.
Removed datastores related commands from trove-manage.
Changed response from datastore-list, now non-administrative user can see only
those datastores which have at least one active version.

Partially implements: blueprint datastores-mgmt-api

Depends-On: I01c0ecc276a73fbbc06ec39bfaa1c66f47fc3a9c Trove
Depends-On: Iee7ed7b141548ef64231acad6319e769d356b97f python-troveclient
Depends-On: I6d57f7e65c9b3e86abdbf5dae10647ea62f8fccc python-troveclient

Change-Id: Ia8ba15ff06c47cb46d68472b336b8ffc1a5e9722

commit_message:
Adds a configure item for public bridge setting

This patch adds a configure item so that we can choose not to
set the gateway IP on public bridge. It will allow to use external
gateway as the floating IPs' exit.

Change-Id: I4874b5b88bc63a0cf429ac2d0725081269059290
Closes-bug: 1339982

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6558, 'name': 'Sukhdev Kapur', 'email': 'sukhdevkapur@gmail.com', 'username': 'sukhdev-8'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12820, 'name': 'Wee Loong Kuan', 'email': 'kuanweeloong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kuanweeloong'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-08-07 01:39:33.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceilometer', 'lib/databases/mysql', 'lib/ironic', 'lib/cinder', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/nova', 'lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-baremetal', 'lib/databases/postgresql', 'lib/sahara', 'lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-ironic', 'lib/database', 'lib/heat', 'lib/keystone', 'lib/swift', 'lib/glance', 'lib/marconi', 'lib/trove'], 'message': "Adds more fine grained authentication for setup.

This change adds the ability to set different user passwords, as well
as database user and passwords, for each openstack service. The
former is set by setting {SERVICE_NAME}_PASSWORD in local.conf. The
latter is set by setting {SERVICE_NAME}_DB{USER|PASSWORD} in
local.conf.

If these variables are not set, then the database passwords and users
default to $DATABASE_USER and $DATABASE_PASSWORD, while the passwords
default to $SERVICE_PASSWORD.

For instance, if I wanted the nova user have 'novapassword' as a
password, I would set NOVA_PASSWORD=novapassword in local.conf.
Similarly, if I wanted Nova to use 'novadbuser:novadbpassword' to
login to the database, I would set NOVA_DBUSER=novadbuser and
NOVA_DBPASSWORD=novadbpassword in local.conf.

This is implemented by reading in the values of
{SERVICE_NAME}_PASSWORD and {SERVICE_NAME}_DB{USER,PASSWORD} when the
install_{SERVICE_NAME} functions are called in the setup scripts.

Note that the openstack services supported are:
Nova, Neutron, Keystone, Glance, Swift, Heat, Ceilometer, Cinder

All other addons (E.g. opendaylight) default to
$DATABASE_{USER,PASSWORD} and $SERVICE_PASSWORD

Change-Id: I6ac35ade270b5b88cb688a2e8df3faac088fec92
Closes-bug: #1353752
"}]
commit_message:
Adds more fine grained authentication for setup.

This change adds the ability to set different user passwords, as well
as database user and passwords, for each openstack service. The
former is set by setting {SERVICE_NAME}_PASSWORD in local.conf. The
latter is set by setting {SERVICE_NAME}_DB{USER|PASSWORD} in
local.conf.

If these variables are not set, then the database passwords and users
default to $DATABASE_USER and $DATABASE_PASSWORD, while the passwords
default to $SERVICE_PASSWORD.

For instance, if I wanted the nova user have 'novapassword' as a
password, I would set NOVA_PASSWORD=novapassword in local.conf.
Similarly, if I wanted Nova to use 'novadbuser:novadbpassword' to
login to the database, I would set NOVA_DBUSER=novadbuser and
NOVA_DBPASSWORD=novadbpassword in local.conf.

This is implemented by reading in the values of
{SERVICE_NAME}_PASSWORD and {SERVICE_NAME}_DB{USER,PASSWORD} when the
install_{SERVICE_NAME} functions are called in the setup scripts.

Note that the openstack services supported are:
Nova, Neutron, Keystone, Glance, Swift, Heat, Ceilometer, Cinder

All other addons (E.g. opendaylight) default to
$DATABASE_{USER,PASSWORD} and $SERVICE_PASSWORD

Change-Id: I6ac35ade270b5b88cb688a2e8df3faac088fec92
Closes-bug: #1353752

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron'], 'message': 'Allow devstack to configure multiple private networks

This is a change to support testing of the Tempest functionality
for running in environments with multiple available networks.  It
defaults to disabled to not break any existing environments, but
once the Tempest change has merged it could be enabled in one of
the Tempest gate tests.

Note that this currently only applies to Neutron.

In order to tell devstack to create the extra network, set
Q_CREATE_EXTRA_NETWORK=True in localrc.

Change-Id: I7a17b887dc22c4fda6c4feafecd34430ad2ffb7d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow devstack to configure multiple private networks

This is a change to support testing of the Tempest functionality
for running in environments with multiple available networks.  It
defaults to disabled to not break any existing environments, but
once the Tempest change has merged it could be enabled in one of
the Tempest gate tests.

Note that this currently only applies to Neutron.

In order to tell devstack to create the extra network, set
Q_CREATE_EXTRA_NETWORK=True in localrc.

Change-Id: I7a17b887dc22c4fda6c4feafecd34430ad2ffb7d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 333, 'name': 'Isaku Yamahata', 'email': 'isaku.yamahata@gmail.com', 'username': 'yamahata'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron', 'lib/neutron_plugins/services/service_agent'], 'message': 'neutron/service-agent: support consolidated service agent

This patch is devstack support for l3-agent-consolidation of Neutron.
New configuration variables are introduced.
q-svc-agt: service name of new consolidated agent
Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS: comma separated list of service name to consolidate
NOTE:For now lbaas_haproxy agent can't be consolidated because of
periodic_interval. So it's run as a single binary.

e.g.
enable_service q-svc-agt
Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS="q-dhcp,q-l3,q-metering,q-lbaas,q-vpn"

Implements: blueprint l3-agent-consolidation
Change-Id: Iac48a157fc58513cc0f0277f51dae76478bfb203
'}]
commit_message:
neutron/service-agent: support consolidated service agent

This patch is devstack support for l3-agent-consolidation of Neutron.
New configuration variables are introduced.
q-svc-agt: service name of new consolidated agent
Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS: comma separated list of service name to consolidate
NOTE:For now lbaas_haproxy agent can't be consolidated because of
periodic_interval. So it's run as a single binary.

e.g.
enable_service q-svc-agt
Q_CONSOLIDATED_AGENTS="q-dhcp,q-l3,q-metering,q-lbaas,q-vpn"

Implements: blueprint l3-agent-consolidation
Change-Id: Iac48a157fc58513cc0f0277f51dae76478bfb203

subject: Fix check path of pxebin when variable isn't set
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-14 15:37:24.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Fix check path of pxebin when variable isn't set

This patch fixes the case where devstack is configured to install
ironic and the host OS isn't supported.

Here is an example script to illustrate that the validation fails when $pxebin
is not set:

$ cat > test.sh <<EOF
touch /tmp/foo
test -f /tmp && echo "/tmp/foo is a file"
test -f $bar && echo "This shouldn't be printed"
test -f "$bar" && echo "This isn't printed"
bar=/tmp/foo
test -f "$bar" && echo "this is OK"
EOF
$ bash -x test.sh
+ touch /tmp/foo
+ test -f /tmp
+ test -f
+ echo 'This shouldn'\''t be printed'
This shouldn't be printed
+ test -f ''
+ bar=/tmp/foo
+ test -f /tmp/foo
+ echo 'this is OK'
this is OK

Change-Id: Idaf377b8bf092d631bf77522af570faf2b47252a
Closes-Bug: 1356946
'}]
commit_message:
Fix check path of pxebin when variable isn't set

This patch fixes the case where devstack is configured to install
ironic and the host OS isn't supported.

Here is an example script to illustrate that the validation fails when $pxebin
is not set:

$ cat > test.sh <<EOF
touch /tmp/foo
test -f /tmp && echo "/tmp/foo is a file"
test -f $bar && echo "This shouldn't be printed"
test -f "$bar" && echo "This isn't printed"
bar=/tmp/foo
test -f "$bar" && echo "this is OK"
EOF
$ bash -x test.sh
+ touch /tmp/foo
+ test -f /tmp
+ test -f
+ echo 'This shouldn'\''t be printed'
This shouldn't be printed
+ test -f ''
+ bar=/tmp/foo
+ test -f /tmp/foo
+ echo 'this is OK'
this is OK

Change-Id: Idaf377b8bf092d631bf77522af570faf2b47252a
Closes-Bug: 1356946

subject: An example of Certificate Generation with devstack
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 7662, 'name': 'Rob Crittenden', 'email': 'rcritten@redhat.com', 'username': 'rcritten'}, {'_account_id': 8116, 'name': 'John Dennis', 'email': 'jdennis@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdennis'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-06-10 08:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tls'], 'message': "An example of Certificate Generation with devstack

This uses the in-built CA generator rather than certmonger because
1. As far as i can see certmonger will ONLY issue self-signed unless
   attached to an external CA.
2. I would have then had to figure out how to make sure the certmonger
   process was up and running before requesting.

However the basic process is the same. In the event that you don't get
the certificates you expect for an enabled cert then you should generate
some new ones. Whether we used the inbuilt OpenSSL or Certmonger is then
just figuring out how to do that abstraction in bash.

Because we just set the environment variables that the rest of devstack
expects the whole thing will work in much the same way as the user
inputted variables.

Change-Id: I3a80481743541822581e694cd6c37d4b49e43b6f
"}]
commit_message:
An example of Certificate Generation with devstack

This uses the in-built CA generator rather than certmonger because
1. As far as i can see certmonger will ONLY issue self-signed unless
   attached to an external CA.
2. I would have then had to figure out how to make sure the certmonger
   process was up and running before requesting.

However the basic process is the same. In the event that you don't get
the certificates you expect for an enabled cert then you should generate
some new ones. Whether we used the inbuilt OpenSSL or Certmonger is then
just figuring out how to do that abstraction in bash.

Because we just set the environment variables that the rest of devstack
expects the whole thing will work in much the same way as the user
inputted variables.

Change-Id: I3a80481743541822581e694cd6c37d4b49e43b6f

subject: Add parameter to configure number of Nova workers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 7175, 'name': 'Robbie Harwood', 'email': 'rharwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'frozencemetery'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-30 14:23:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'Add parameter to configure number of Nova workers

DevStack was setting Nova to load four workers per each Nova service as
CI envs run on four CPU cores, according to comment in
I09f4c6f57e71982b8c7fc92645b3ebec12ff1348.

Later on in Id8009b5fd37cef03ca66cb5bf44211039ac895ba Nova was added
with detection of the number of cores available.

The memory consumption taken by each worker can be considerably
high specially on low-end development environments.

This patch introduces the NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER configuration parameter
where users can adjust the number of workers Nova should load.

Change-Id: I3648ff76a8e14b6abd85a2904df5eb4bc31e47ab
'}]
commit_message:
Add parameter to configure number of Nova workers

DevStack was setting Nova to load four workers per each Nova service as
CI envs run on four CPU cores, according to comment in
I09f4c6f57e71982b8c7fc92645b3ebec12ff1348.

Later on in Id8009b5fd37cef03ca66cb5bf44211039ac895ba Nova was added
with detection of the number of cores available.

The memory consumption taken by each worker can be considerably
high specially on low-end development environments.

This patch introduces the NOVA_WORKERS_NUMBER configuration parameter
where users can adjust the number of workers Nova should load.

Change-Id: I3648ff76a8e14b6abd85a2904df5eb4bc31e47ab

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-08-19 18:55:05.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': "TESTING: Add secondary mirror for ubuntu

We are seeing occasional rackspace apt mirror failures, to work around
this in case of a failure swap mirror with anl.gov.
Use anl.gov because it is in the US, has a 10GB network and is usually
up to date.

This workaround is needed because apt-get doesn't know how to gracefully
recover if the primary source vanishes.

This is for testing only a proper solution belongs in devstack-gate.
devstack-gate can run an apt-get update before entering devstack and run
this action if apt-get update has issues.

Testing what happens with a mirror that will return 404 errors.

Change-Id: I5e9fc1edab8f6531285b3ea02641aec9470cad4d
"}]
commit_message:
TESTING: Add secondary mirror for ubuntu

We are seeing occasional rackspace apt mirror failures, to work around
this in case of a failure swap mirror with anl.gov.
Use anl.gov because it is in the US, has a 10GB network and is usually
up to date.

This workaround is needed because apt-get doesn't know how to gracefully
recover if the primary source vanishes.

This is for testing only a proper solution belongs in devstack-gate.
devstack-gate can run an apt-get update before entering devstack and run
this action if apt-get update has issues.

Testing what happens with a mirror that will return 404 errors.

Change-Id: I5e9fc1edab8f6531285b3ea02641aec9470cad4d

commit_message:
Synchronize $DATA_DIR and $SERVICE_DIR with $DEST in stackrc

If only $DEST is specified and $DATA_DIR (also $SERVICE_DIR)
is not specified in "local.conf", after having been sourced,
the variables $DEST and $DATA_DIR (also $SERVICE_DIR) are no
longer synchronized.

Change-Id: Ie9b2777bbd6cd5d99ac51560b83a85ecc54fb188
Closes-bug: #1387934

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-16 13:56:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': 'Permit non-loopback guest access to Rabbit

Recent versions of RabbitMQ have defaulted to only permitting the
guest user to access over a loopback interface. To allow the guest
user to connect from a remote host set the loopback_users

Change-Id: Ie0dd4167399cc9a94624da4948bb7816b6b9ef90
'}]
commit_message:
Permit non-loopback guest access to Rabbit

Recent versions of RabbitMQ have defaulted to only permitting the
guest user to access over a loopback interface. To allow the guest
user to connect from a remote host set the loopback_users
configuration as shown in http://www.rabbitmq.com/access-control.html

Change-Id: Ie0dd4167399cc9a94624da4948bb7816b6b9ef90
